name: WebUXUIDemo
observations: Repository name: webuxui-demo
Owner: arisng
Current branch: main
Focus: interactive web UI demos showcasing modern web platform features, particularly Scoped View Transitions
Architecture: Each demo in demos/<demo-name>/ with index.html, styles.css, script.js, README.md
Standalone demos with no shared dependencies
Progressive enhancement and mobile-first design

name: ScopedViewTransitionsDemo
observations: Name: Mobile Scoped View Transitions Demo
Location: demos/scoped-view-transitions/
Files: index.html, styles.css, script.js, README.md, ENHANCEMENT_PLAN.md
Features: Mobile-First Design, Social Feed Simulation, Individual Post Updates, Bottom Navigation, Simultaneous Isolation, Progressive Enhancement
Setup: Enable Experimental Web Platform features in Chrome, Open index.html
Usage: Post interactions, navigation, auto-update
Use cases: Social media feeds, news apps, messaging apps, e-commerce, dashboard apps
Browser support: Chrome 140+
Related links: Scoped View Transitions Explainer, View Transitions API Docs

name: ScopedViewTransitions
observations: Modern web platform feature
Used for isolated animations in demos

name: HTML
observations: Used in demos
Semantic elements
contain: layout; for transition elements

name: CSS
observations: Assign unique view-transition-name to scoped elements
Use ::view-transition-group(), ::view-transition-old(), ::view-transition-new() for custom animations

name: JavaScript
observations: Check API support with HTMLElement.prototype.startViewTransition
Provide manual fallbacks using opacity transitions

name: LocalTesting
observations: Run python -m http.server 8000 from project root
Open http://localhost:8000/demos/<demo>/index.html in Chrome

name: BrowserSetup
observations: Enable 'Experimental Web Platform features' in chrome://flags/#enable-experimental-web-platform-features

name: VersionControl
observations: Use atomic commits with descriptive messages (e.g., 'feat: add pull-to-refresh functionality')

name: CodePatterns
observations: HTML: semantic elements, add contain: layout; to transition elements
CSS: assign unique view-transition-name
JavaScript: check API support, provide fallbacks
Animations: use ::view-transition-group() etc.
Mobile-First: design for touch, use flexbox

name: Examples
observations: Scoped transitions: element.startViewTransition({ callback: () => { element.innerHTML = newContent; } });
Fallback: manualTransition(element, () => { element.innerHTML = newContent; }, 600);
Key files: demos/scoped-view-transitions/script.js for transition logic, styles.css for animations

name: Testing
observations: Test in Chrome with experimental flags
Verify fallbacks by disabling the flag
Check mobile responsiveness
